p: Once bacterial endophytes inhabit plant tissues, a mutualistic relationship between the bacteria and plant is formed. The bacterial endophytes act as producers of biologically active metabolites, while the plant provides the bacterial community with nutrients [ 19]. In this study, inoculation of the two most potent bacterial endophytes in maize seeds displayed better root length as well as better fresh and dry root weight compared with the controls (un-inoculated seeds). The consistent with Hassan [ 19], who reported that the inoculation of Bacillus cereus Tp.1B and Bacillus subtilis Tp.6B in maize seeds showed enhancement in root length and root weight as compared to the controls.
